DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the status of the p53 gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measure of the presence of a suppressor gene that normally inhibits the growth of tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor suppressor gene that normally inhibits the growth of tumors. This gene is altered in many types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a critical role in cell cycle regulation and has tumor suppressor activity.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Added NCI Thesaurus Concept Code. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Level; a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Analysis; examination and interpretation._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).:Analysis; examination and interpretation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of G. Diaz 7/2010
